intro: Chelonistele amplissima var. schweinfurthiana, commonly known as the Schweinfurthian star moss, is a unique species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant has a complex thallus structure with distinct leaf-like structures called phyllidia, which are arranged in a spiral pattern. It is often associated with high humidity and can be found in temperate to subtropical regions. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its native range.
